thread.title: Area Sports: College soccer, HS soccer, volleyball; JV results, Middle schools
thread.title_full: Area Sports: College soccer, HS soccer, volleyball; JV results, Middle schools

author: Staff reports
title: Area Sports: College soccer, HS soccer, volleyball; JV results, Middle schools
text: Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 9:17 PM Updated at 9:19 PM Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 9:17 PM Updated at 9:19 PM Women’s college golf GWU’s Dodson honored — Gardner-Webb junior Taylor Dodson was named a Big South Conference co-women’s golfer of the week for matches played Sept. 24-30, sharing the honor with High Point’s Tan Cheeranont. Dodson and Cheeranont tied for fifth out of 89 players at the Lady Pirate Intercollegiate tournament hosted by East Carolina in Greenville, carding matching 223s. Dodson (69-78-76) posted her second top-five finish of the season, holing out eight birdies to help the Runnin’ Bulldogs to a fifth-place finish in the 17-team field. Varsity boys soccer Kings Mountain 9, Draughn 0 — The Mountaineers improved to 7-2 in SMAC play (10-2 overall) with the league victory. Weston Harmon and Luke Rikard tallied three goals apiece to pace the Kings Mountain attack. Jordan Sweezy, Josh Scism and Adam Kiser also recorded goals. Nolan Raby supplied a pair of assists while Harmon, Sweezy, Mason Nguyen, Chase Yow, Bailey Goodson and Brandon Quevedo-Johns also had assists. Kings Mountain travels to Crest on Monday. Varsity volleyball East Burke 3, Shelby 1 (25-12, 25-11, 20-25, 25-15) — The Golden Lions dropped to 3-9 in SMAC play (3-13 overall) with the league defeat. Hallie Kwiatkowski recorded 12 kills and three aces to lead the Shelby attack. Megan Cole-Edwards and Tamerika Natt added seven and four kills, respectively. Shelby hosts East Rutherford on Monday. JV Soccer Shelby 5, Polk County 0 – Chase Hendrick and Grady Morgan split time in goal as the junior Golden Lions blanked their non-conference foe Thursday. James Mabry and Jallien Palmer had two goals apiece for Shelby and Daniel Pate also found the net. Felix Costila and Noah Martin had assists for the victors. David Blankenship and Aaron Price paced the defensive effort for Shelby, which hosts East Rutherford Monday at 5. JV Football Shelby 50, East Burke 0 – Six Malik Surratt touchdown passes powered the junior Golden Lions to a road win Thursday. Surratt hit Jhalen Cannon on scoring throws of 11 and 65 yards, hooked up with Fabian Pettis on a 58-yard touchdown, found Maleek McMullens on a 40-yard connection, threw to Santana Eaves on a 30-yard scoring play and located Jordan Brown on a 20-yard touchdown pass. Chavis Reid had a 55-yard touchdown run for the junior Lions. Sarratt ran for two points and also passed to Cannon for a two-pointer. Zachary Ledbetter kicked two extra points. East Rutherford 27, Burns 18 – The junior Bulldogs led 18-14 late in the third quarter but saw the host Cavaliers rally for the win. Crest 47, Chase 8 – Davian Pryor provided touchdown runs of 10 and 65 yards while Austin Jones fired touchdown passes of 50 and 5 yards to Ty Housh as the junior Chargers romped. Page 2 of 2 - OD Ross had an 80-yard scoring run, Nygil Odom had a 2-yard touchdown run and Tre Williams pushed in a score from 1-yard out for the victors. Logan Costner booted five extra points for Crest. Middle school softball Kings Mountain 18, Lincolnton (3 inns.) — Keegan Irby pitched all three innings to record the mound win for the Patriots. Emma White, Sarah Bell and Leah Hoyle led the Patriots at the plate. Kings Mountain travels to Chase on Tuesday. By Staff reports
